[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Hotel Management System (HMS) defines requirements for managing reservations, occupancy, staff, and financial transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: HMS supports room booking, guest check-ins, staff management, rent calculations, and financial reporting.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: HMS integrates with reservation databases, payment gateways, and guest records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: HMS provides dashboards for managers, staff, and guests to manage reservations and transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: HMS supports POS terminals, computing devices, and mobile access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: HMS uses PostgreSQL for structured storage  REST APIs for reservations  billing  and staff management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: HMS secures transactions via TLS encryption and multi-factor authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: HMS is optimized for high-traffic booking operations and financial transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: HMS manages room allocation  guest tracking  billing  financial reports.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: HMS is configurable for single and multi-chain hotels.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: HMS integrates with payment, tax, and compliance systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: HMS tracks room availability  guest check-ins  staff records  rent calculations  revenue reports.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for hotel managers  front desk staff  finance teams  and guests.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: HMS requires internet connectivity for real-time reservations and billing updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: HMS relies on accurate room availability  pricing data  and tax compliance.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with reservation databases for managing room availability.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with payment gateways for processing guest transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall track room occupancy, guest details, and booking periods (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall calculate rent per room using occupancy, pricing, and taxes (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate financial reports, including revenue, tax calculations, and discounts applied (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a management dashboard with search, filters, and financial tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process reservations and rent calculations within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store room details, including type, number, price, and occupancy status.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store guest records, including check-in, check-out, and payment history.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store financial transactions, including charges, taxes, and revenue data.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce authentication, encryption, and role-based access controls.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with financial and hospitality industry standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log booking modifications, check-ins, rent calculations, and refunds for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests room allocation, billing accuracy, guest tracking, and revenue calculations.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance manuals.
[SEC] 5. References: Hospitality regulations, tax policies, and financial standards.
